alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 6:17PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Johnson from Buffalo southward to about 10 miles north of Kaycee. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 613 PM MDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in Clear Creek drainage due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly as between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Clear Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. The intensity of the storms have decreased significantly with only a tenth to a quarter inch of additional rainfall is expected. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
